name: OPD-HPI notes
description:
• Location
  • Severity
  • Quality
  • Timing : Constant / Intermittent, how long did it last
  • Duration : When did it Start
  • Modifying Factors : Anything make it better or worse
  • Context : What were you doing when it started
  • Associated Signs or Symptoms

name: OPD-Pertinent system
description:
General
HEENT
CV
Lungs
Abdomen
MSK
Skin
Neuro
Psych

name: CBIMNCI 2 to 59-General danger signs present
description: Baby cannot suck/swallow breast milk, vomits everything, convulsions (history), lethargic or unconscious, convulsions (during observation)

name: CBIMNCI 2 to 59-ARI classification
description:
*Severe pneumonia 

<li>presence of danger sign

<li>presence of stridor in a silent child

 *Pneumonia 

<li>chest in-drawing or wheezing)

 *No Pneumonia (no sign of severe pneumonia and pneumonia)

name: Childhood Illness-Diarrhoea present
description: watery stool three times or more in 24 hours, Dysentery: Presence of blood in the stool, Chronic Diarrhoea - Diarrhoea for more than 14 days

name: Childhood Illness-Dehydration status
description:
Severe Dehydration (If any of two given signs present)

	<li>Lethargic or unconscious

        <li>Body movement less than normal

	<li>Sunken eyes

	<li>Skin pinch goes back very slowly (>2 seconds)

	<li>Infant less than one month of age

Some dehydration: 
	<li>Irritable
 
	<li>Sunken eyes

	<li>Skin pinch goes back slowly (<2 seconds)
                                                           
No Dehydration:

	<li>No sufficient signs to classify under severe or some dehydration

name: CBIMNCI 2 to 59-Nature of fever
description: Describe the nature of fever in terms of frequency, diurnal pattern, severity, +- chills and rigor, or any other specific features

name: Stratified malaria risk
description: Also look for travel history in last 30 days

name: CBIMNCI 2 to 59-Complicated malaria
description: General danger signs present; Neck stiffness; General danger signs with Microscopic/RDT positive (Send for investigations)

name: CBIMNCI 2 to 59-Non falciparum malaria
description: Microscopic RDT Positive and Falciparum Negative

name: CBIMNCI 2 to 59-Fever without malaria
description: Running nose, Measles like rash, other causes of fever and Microscopic RDT Negative

name: CBIMNCI 2 to 59-Other cause of fever
description: General Danger signs present; Neck stiffness

name: CBIMNCI 2 to 59-Measles in last 3 months
description: Look for oral lesions and their extension; eye discharge, cloudy cornea

name: CBIMNCI 2 to 59-Severe complicated measles
description: General danger signs, cloudy cornea, several oral lesions with/without extension

name: CBIMNCI 2 to 59-Ear infection present
description:
<li>Acute ear infection (ear pain or discharge from ear for <14 days) 

<li>Chronic ear infection (no pain and ear discharge for > 14 days)

<li>Mastoiditis (pain and swelling behind ear)

<li>No ear infection (no signs from above)

name: CBIMNCI 2 to 59-Advised for OTP/local health facility
shortname: Follow up advised for OTP/local health facility
